cold_snaps.status: There is currently no cold snap.  This year there have been 6 cold snaps, usually there are 3.7 cold snaps per year.

extreme.status: The record temperature difference stands at 26.7°C (0.4-27.1°C), set on 29 April 2025.

heatwave.status: No heatwave is happening right now.  There have been 6 such events this year, compared to a usual average of 1.9 per year.

heaviest_rainfall.status: Today's storm ranked 8th for total rainfall with 13.04mm having fallen, indicating an exceptionally wet day.  8.6mm per hour fell at points during the storm which lasted 7.9 hours.  The most intense rainfall recorded took place on 04 January 2025, with precipitation totalling 27.64mm reaching 4.6mm per hour at times.  The event lasted 15.9 hours.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The highest ranked rain rate was registered today with a peak rate of 27.0mm per hour, highlighting an extreme precipitation event.  7.99mm of rain fell during the storm's 2.0 hours length.

storm.status: A relentless rainstorm took place on 23 November 2024, it lasted 23.2 hours, delivered 24.56mm of rain at a maximum rate of 6.4mm per hour.
Weather alert: A storm is passing through the area.  This marks the first storm since 02 September 2025.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The ongoing rainy stretch, 9 days and counting so far started on 26 August 2025 and ranks 5th in length since records started in August 2024.  The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

tropical: The most recent tropical night was on 18 July 2025 and this has only occurred 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current wind direction is south-westerly (207°), which is about average.  In the UK, a south-westerly wind often means mild and wet weather.

gusts.status: The largest wind gust ever was on 13 October 2012 with a value of 93.7 mph.

run.status: The top recorded wind run is 1754 miles on 21 October 2012.  The long-term average wind run is 229.42 miles and so far today the wind run is 78.27 miles.

speed.status: The top recorded wind speed is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

summary.description:
Today, a bit warmer for the feels like temperature (up 4.0°C) and outside temperature (up 3.1°C) and more moisture-laden rainfall (up 2.4 mm).

The past week and month had observable variation in cloud levels (up 1653 m) and inside temperature (up 2.2°C) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 65.3m lower than yesterday, 550.1m lower than the past week, 1653.4m lower than the past month.

The cloud levels for yesterday ranged from 713m to 1594m and averaged 1001.6m, while the past week and month indicated warmer conditions.

summary.summary: Inside; temperatures should be quite comfortable. Outside; warm but comfortable temperatures are expected. Also, very clammy and humid and little or no wind. Light to moderate rain is forecast, partial cloudiness with some periods of sun, and a mix of sun and clouds. The weather may change rapidly and become worse.
